articles.headline: Liquor Taxes Could Go Up 400%, Thanks to Congressional Dysfunction
articles.snippet: A temporary cut in federal taxes on alcohol fueled the growth of American distilleries, but its expiration threatens their demise.
articles.abstract: A temporary cut in federal taxes on alcohol fueled the growth of American distilleries, but its expiration threatens their demise.
articles.lead_paragraph: The last two years have been good ones for Lyon Distilling. At the small rum producer in St. Michaels, Md., a town on the Eastern Shore of Chesapeake Bay, production has jumped from 4,000 bottles a year to 40,000. Four employees have become 15.

articles.headline: Purdue Pharma Payments to Sackler Family Soared Amid Opioid Crisis
articles.snippet: A new audit finds that the family directed $10.7 billion from the drugmaker to family-controlled trusts and holding companies, as legal pressure tightened around Purdue.
articles.abstract: A new audit finds that the family directed $10.7 billion from the drugmaker to family-controlled trusts and holding companies, as legal pressure tightened around Purdue.
articles.lead_paragraph: As scrutiny of Purdue Pharma’s role in the opioid epidemic intensified during the past dozen years, its owners, members of the Sackler family, withdrew more than $10 billion from the company, distributing it among trusts and overseas holding companies, according to a new audit commissioned by Purdue.
articles.byline: By Jan Hoffman and Danny Hakim

articles.headline: The Tax Break for Children, Except the Ones Who Need It Most
articles.snippet: The child tax credit, begun in 1997 as a tax cut, has become an anti-poverty program. But more than a third of children don’t receive it because their parents earn too little.
articles.abstract: The child tax credit, begun in 1997 as a tax cut, has become an anti-poverty program. But more than a third of children don’t receive it because their parents earn too little.
articles.lead_paragraph: MONROE, La. — With two children and a third on the way, Ciera Dismuke worked five jobs last year while earning just under $15,000. Although the Trump administration often boasts that it doubled the federal child tax credit to $2,000 per child, Ms. Dismuke, like millions of Americans, earned too little to fully qualify. Instead, she got $934 a child, an increase of just $75.

articles.headline: Netflix Looks Abroad as Growth Slows in the U.S.
articles.snippet: The streaming giant, which likes to keep its numbers to itself, gave out fresh information on regional subscriptions in an official filing.
articles.abstract: The streaming giant, which likes to keep its numbers to itself, gave out fresh information on regional subscriptions in an official filing.
articles.lead_paragraph: Netflix is the dominant streaming platform in the United States. More than 60 million people in the country pay a total of $9 billion annually to watch the original series like “The Crown” and Martin Scorsese’s Homeric mob elegy “The Irishman,” which was viewed by 26 million accounts in the first week of release.

articles.headline: Giuliani Provides Details of What Trump Knew About Ambassador’s Removal
articles.snippet: Rudolph Giuliani said in an interview that he briefed the president “a couple of times” about Marie Yovanovitch, the envoy to Ukraine, setting her recall in motion.
articles.abstract: Rudolph Giuliani said in an interview that he briefed the president “a couple of times” about Marie Yovanovitch, the envoy to Ukraine, setting her recall in motion.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Rudolph W. Giuliani said on Monday that he provided President Trump with detailed information this year about how the United States ambassador to Ukraine was, in Mr. Giuliani’s view, impeding investigations that could benefit Mr. Trump, setting in motion the ambassador’s recall from her post.

articles.headline: China Responds Slowly, and a Pig Disease Becomes a Lethal Epidemic
articles.snippet: The bungled effort to contain African swine fever could result in higher Chinese food costs for years and shows the limits of Beijing’s top-down approach to problems.
articles.abstract: The bungled effort to contain African swine fever could result in higher Chinese food costs for years and shows the limits of Beijing’s top-down approach to problems.
articles.lead_paragraph: WULONGQIAO, China — A devastating disease spreading from China has wiped out roughly one-quarter of the world’s pigs, reshaping farming and hitting the diets and pocketbooks of consumers around the globe.
articles.byline: By Keith Bradsher and Ailin Tang

articles.headline: Mortgage Rates Below 1% Put Europe on Alert for Housing Bubble
articles.snippet: Cheap money is driving a property boom that is pricing many residents out of big cities and causing concern among policymakers.
articles.abstract: Cheap money is driving a property boom that is pricing many residents out of big cities and causing concern among policymakers.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — Europe’s economy is struggling to gain traction after years of anemic growth. But the rock-bottom interest rates meant to power a recovery are fueling a property boom that is creating a new set of problems.
